comments:
I had a hard time to find out all required JARs  and replace the hard coded 
Windows path to the engine to finally get the demo "RunReport.java" 
(http://www.eclipse.org/birt/index.php?page=deploy/engine.html) running.

The shell output is only:


----------------
12.10.2005 14:52:46 org.eclipse.birt.core.util.BirtTimer logTimeTaken
INFO: Engine startup takes 406 Milliseconds.
----------------

In the current working directory I found a "meta.log" file with the following 
content:


----------------
2005-10-12 02:52:47  Message [Extension loading error]
					 Exception 
[org.eclipse.birt.report.model.metadata.ExtensionException: Message:The 
extension point [org.eclipse.birt.report.model.encryptionHelper] is not found. 
Error code:EXTENSION_POINT_NOT_FOUND

(ExtensionLoader.java:103)
	at org.eclipse.birt.report.model.metadata.ExtensionLoader.load
(ExtensionLoader.java:63)

]

What now?


(The Webpage to integrate BIRT - http://www.eclipse.org/birt/index.php?
page=deploy/engine.html - should be rewritten for beginners to get a basic 
example running with all necessary information needed like classpath, required 
configurations, environment, etc.)

On http://www.eclipse.org/birt/index.php?page=deploy/engine.html there is a 
link right below the RunReport.java that has an ANT project with a readme.txt 
that shows which files need to be copied as well as how to set the engine home 
directory.

Added note to the deploy/engine.html page.
